section.section: The trustees shall appoint a Director, with the approval of the Governor.
The Director is the chief administrative officer of the Trust.

text.section:
The Director shall have:
knowledge in architecture, history, archaeology, or another appropriate discipline relating to historic preservation; and
experience in historic preservation or related fields.
The Director serves at the pleasure of the Board and may be removed with the concurrence of the Governor.

section.section: The Director is entitled to the salary provided in the State budget.
The Director may employ a staff in accordance with the State budget.

text.section: Under the direction of the Board, the Director shall perform the duties and functions that the Board prescribes.
